name: RUSH (itch) (JoesLastLife)
description:
rush1

/rʌʃ/

verb

1. move with urgent haste. "Oliver rushed after her"   

      Similar: hurry / dash 

      Opposite: dawdle

      Vulgar slang: drag/tear/haul ass

2. dash towards (someone or something) in an attempt to attack or capture. "to rush the bank and fire willy-nilly could be disastrous for everyone"                                                             Similar: attack / charge

noun

1. a sudden quick movement towards something, typically by a number of people. "there was a rush for the door" 

      Similar: dash

2. (AMERICAN FOOTBALL) an act of advancing forward, especially towards the quarterback.

game

1. drive around a small city while racing against the clock, picking up and dropping off passengers and avoiding the other cars.
